astAuctions.name: Unpublished Lots Test
astAuctions.description:
*She Inspires Art,* an exclusive evening of installation, performance and fundraising, has brought together a large group of artists, curators, and patrons to raise funds for the life-changing programs run by Women for Women International. *She Inspires Art* is chaired by Lady Alison Deighton and curated by Tamar Arnon and Eli Zagury. Artsy is proud to partner with Women for Women International to host online bidding for the strong selection of contemporary art, experiences, and jewelry available in the live and silent auctions of *She Inspires Art.*

Bidding will close on Artsy at 11:59PM ET on September 15, 2015 (4:59AM BST on September 16, 2015). The highest bids placed on Artsy will be transferred and executed against other bidders at the *She Inspires Art* benefit event held the evening of September 16, 2015 at Bonhams, New Bond Street, London.

Please note: While bidding on Artsy will be conducted in USD, bids will be converted from USD to GBP before they are executed at the benefit event. After the auction, winning bidders will be notified by Women for Women International. All the auction pieces are in London and shipping and taxes will be at an additional cost to the auction lot winner. Women for Women International will contact auction winners to confirm shipment costs. Payment will be collected in GBP. Please refer to individual lot listings on Artsy for more information. Women for Women International Charity Number: 1115109, Company Number: 05650155.

**Questions?** Email specialist@artsy.net or call +1.646.504.7607 weekdays 9:00AM-6:00PM ET and weekends 11:00AM - 4:00PM ET.

astAuctions.name: Rago Auctions: Remix
astAuctions.description:
Artsy presents **Rago Auctions: Remix**, featuring sexy, stylish pieces of modern design, urbane antiques, contemporary and classical art, and more. In advance of the auction, browse lots and place max bids before live bidding begins on **June 10th at 11:00am ET.**

When the sale opens, all pre-registered Artsy users can participate and watch the bidding unfold in real time. Registration for the live auction will close on **June 9th at 11:00am ET.**

astAuctions.description:

When the sale opens, all pre-registered Artsy users can participate and watch the bidding unfold in real time. Registration for the live auction will close on **June 6th at 9:00pm WEST (4:00pm EDT)**.

This auction will be conducted in Euros.

astAuctions.name: Phillips: Evening & Day Editions
astAuctions.description:
Artsy presents **Phillips: Evening & Day Editions**, featuring works by David Hockney, Andy Warhol, Robert Indiana, and more. In advance of the auction, browse lots and place max bids before live bidding begins in London on **June 7th at 2:00pm GMT (9:00am ET) for lots 62 - 264**. Bidding will continue during the evening session at **6:00pm GMT (1:00pm ET) for lots 1 - 61**. 

When the sale opens, all pre-registered Artsy users can participate and watch the bidding unfold in real time. Registration for the live auction will close on **June 6th at 2:00pm GMT (9:00am EST)**.

astAuctions.name: Headlands Center for the Arts: Benefit Auction 2017
astAuctions.description:
Headlands Center for the Arts is a multi-disciplinary, international arts center that provides an unparalleled environment for the creative process and the development of new work and ideas. Located 15 minutes outside of San Francisco just north of the Golden Gate Bridge, Headlands is nestled in a cluster of artist-rehabilitated military buildings in the Golden Gate National Recreation area. Since its founding in 1982, Headlands has supported over 1,400 artists, including notable alumni such as Julie Mehretu, Hank Willis Thomas, Larry Sultan, Toyin Ojih Odutola, Brad Kahlhamer, Tania Bruguera, Ann Hamilton, Rebecca Solnit, Lewis Hyde, Will Oldham, and Andrea Zittel. To view more experience lots available for purchase, please click [here](https://www.artsy.net/headlands-center-for-the-arts/shop). 

Headlands’ Benefit Art Auction is the organization’s biggest fundraising event, and one of the Bay Area’s favorite venues for cutting-edge art. Proceeds directly support Headlands’ mission, artists, and public programs. For more information or to purchase tickets, visit [headlands.org/auction](http://www.headlands.org/event/2017-benefit-art-auction/). 

Online bids will be transferred and executed at the benefit event later that night. Please note, this auction is following a custom set of increments. To view them, please click [here](https://cl.ly/253E3Z3r1K3S).
astAuctions.event_location: Fort Mason Center, Golden Gate National Recreation Area, Landmark Building C, 2 Marina Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94123

astAuctions.name: Phillips: Design
astAuctions.description:
Artsy presents **Phillips: Design**, featuring works by Jean Royère, Gio Ponti, George Nakashima, and more. In advance of the auction, browse lots and place max bids before live bidding begins in New York on **June 6th at 1:00pm ET**.

When the sale opens, all pre-registered Artsy users can participate and watch the bidding unfold in real time. Registration for the live auction will close on **June 5th at 1:00pm ET.**

astAuctions.name: Hamilton-Selway Presents: Blue-Chip Editions
astAuctions.description:
Hamilton-Selway Fine Arts + Artsy present **Hamilton-Selway: Blue-Chip Editions,** featuring an array of artworks by a selection of seminal artists. The auction brings together works by the biggest names in Modern and Contemporary art including Glenn Ligon, Donald Judd, Julie Mehretu, and more. 

Bidding for the auction will close on **May 31st at 4pm PST (7pm ET)**. All lots in this auction are subject to a Buyer's Premium.

astAuctions.name: Doyle: Contemporary Collector
astAuctions.description:
**Doyle Auctions + Artsy** present: “Contemporary Collector,” featuring works by **Maurizio Cattelan**, **FAILE**, and **Joe Coleman**.

A long-needed update of the classic gentleman’s sale, Contemporary Collector is a curated selection of original works, editions, photography and rare books by established and emerging artists. Featured are a collaborative work on paper by graffiti legends Lee Quinones and STASH, a pair of rare prints by Contemporary art superstar Sterling Ruby, and an early poster from Max’s Kansas City signed by Andy Warhol.

Bidding for this auction will close on **Tuesday, May 30th at 6:00pm ET**.

astAuctions.name: Phillips: 20th Century & Contemporary Art & Design Evening Sale
astAuctions.description:
Artsy presents **Phillips: 20th Century & Contemporary Art & Design Evening Sale**, featuring works by Ai Wei Wei, Yoshitomo Nara, Zeng Fanzhi, and more. In advance of the auction in Hong Kong, browse lots and place max bids before live bidding begins on **May 28th at 7:00pm HKT (7:00am ET)**.

When the sale opens, all pre-registered Artsy users can participate and watch the bidding unfold in real time. Registration for the live auction will close on **May 27th at 7:00pm HKT (7:00am ET)**.

This auction will be conducted in Hong Kong Dollars.

astAuctions.name: Forum Auctions: Select Spring Editions
astAuctions.description:
**Forum x Artsy present Select Spring Editions,** an online auction featuring contemporary prints and street art by Banksy, Tom Wesselmann, Stik, and more. **Please note that the initial bid on each lot clears any reserves and can be a winning bid.** 

**Bidding closes on May 25th at 4:00PM ET.** This auction will be conducted in pounds, and all lots are subject to a Buyer’s Premium.

astAuctions.name: Visual AIDS: Benefit Auction 2017
astAuctions.description:
Since 1988, Visual AIDS has used the power of art as a catalyst to provoke dialogue and spur activism in response to HIV/AIDS.  Through our mission and programs, Visual AIDS makes the work of HIV+ artists more accessible and visible. We provide a forum for conversations about artists and their work alongside issues like art activism, inequity in health resources, social justice, and the diverse communities affected by HIV/AIDS, offering perspectives often absent from the national dialogue. 

This auction supports the work of Visual AIDS and is part of the 12th annual Visual AIDS Vanguard Awards (VAVA VOOM) that recognize individuals who, through their work and talent, have used art and activism to raise awareness and fight AIDS. 

Bidding will be open exclusively on Artsy, and will close at **10:00 PM ET on May 22, 2017**. Learn more about the event and purchase tickets [here](https://www.visualaids.org/events/detail/vava-voom-2017).
astAuctions.event_location: Three Sixty°, 10 Desbrosses Street, New York, NY

astAuctions.name: Choice Works: Benefit Auction 2017
astAuctions.description: The art world has shown resounding support for Planned Parenthood, including raising over $2.5 million at the 2015 Choice Works auction, co-chaired by Marilyn Minter, Cindy Sherman, and Laurie Simmons. As a continuation of the Choice Works programming, this silent auction, featuring works by leading artists, will help raise funds needed to safeguard reproductive rights at this critical time.

associated_sale.name: Los Angeles Contemporary Exhibitions: Live Benefit Auction 2017

astAuctions.name: Los Angeles Contemporary Exhibitions: Benefit Auction 2017
astAuctions.description: Los Angeles Contemporary Exhibitions is an internationally recognized nonprofit venue that exhibits and advocates for innovations in art-making and public engagement. LACE's 38th annual auction will benefit their exhibition program that breaks boundaries, advances experimentation, and gives voice to otherwise marginalized voices in art.

Artsy presents **Il Ponte: Modern & Contemporary Art**, featuring works by Alighiero e Boetti, Jean Dubuffet,

associated_sale.name: Heritage Auctions: The Future is Now

currentAuctions.name: Heritage Auctions: The Future is Now Part II
currentAuctions.description:
Heritage Auctions + Artsy present **Heritage Auctions: The Future is Now Part II**, featuring more than 30 artworks by artists who have forever changed our public spaces. The auction brings together some of the biggest names working in street art, with more emerging talent who follow in the tradition of these now iconic artists. A private viewing will be held in Beverly Hills on June 10th from 6:30PM - 9:00PM PT. Please RSVP to specialist@artsymail.com for specific details. 

Bidding for the auction will close on **June 13th at 8:00PM CT (9:00PM ET).** All lots in this auction are subject to a Buyer's Premium.

upcomingAuctions.name: Creative Time: Pledges of Allegiance
upcomingAuctions.description:
Creative Time, the New York based public arts non-profit, is committed to working with artists on the dialogues, debates and dreams of our time. Since 1974, Creative Time has produced over 350 groundbreaking public art projects that ignite the imagination, explore ideas that shape society, and engage millions of people around the globe, as well as the Creative Time Summit - an international convening at the intersection of art and social justice.
 
On June 14th, Flag Day, Creative Time launches ***Pledges of Allegiance***, a serialized commission of sixteen flags, each one created by an acclaimed artist: **Tania Bruguera, Alex Da Corte, Jeremy Deller, LaToya Ruby Frazier, Ann Hamilton, Robert Longo, Josephine Meckseper, Marilyn Minter, Vik Muniz, Jayson Musson, Ahmet Ögüt, Yoko Ono, Trevor Paglen, Pedro Reyes, Rirkrit Tiravanija,** and **Nari Ward.**  Conceived in response to the current political climate, each flag points to an issue the artist is passionate about, a cause they believe is worth fighting for, and speaks to how we might move forward collectively.  The project kicks-off with Marilyn Minter’s *RESIST FLAG* raised on the roof of Creative Time’s headquarters in New York City. For more information on *Pledges of Allegiance* and Creative Time, click [here](http://creativetime.org/projects/pledgesofallegiance/).
 
All proceeds from the *Pledges of Allegiance* auction go towards supporting the project and Creative Time’s visionary programming, while simultaneously sending a powerful show of solidarity in the belief that artistic expression, more than ever, is essential to the public sphere.
 
From June 21 - June 28, all the flags featured in the auction will be on display at Salon94, Freeman Alley, located at 1 Freeman Alley, New York, NY, 10002. The gallery is open Tuesday - Saturday, 11am - 6pm. Stop in to see them in person!
